article.headline: Delaware St. 84, Coppin St. 81
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Marques Oliver converted a three-point play with 1 second left to give Delaware State an 84-81 win over Coppin State Saturday. The Hornets (10-11, 7-3 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference) led by as many as 12 points in the second half, before Coppin State tied it at 81 with 11 seconds remaining. The Eagles (12-12, 7-4) led 41-37 at halftime after shooting 61.5 percent (16 of 26). The Hornets then shot 54.3 percent (19 of 35) from the field and scored 16 points off turnovers in the second half for their sixth straight win. Coppin State made 52.8 percent from the field (28 of 53) but turned it over 17 times, leading to 23 points. Casey Walker scored 24 points, Tahj Tate 22 and Oliver 15 for the Hornets. The Eagles were led by Antonio Williams with 20 points and 14 rebounds and Tony Gallo with 23 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
